VikingQuestions.question: Young Halfdan listened to tales of his famous father who was renowned for his valor and wit. Who was this legendary figure?
Fueled by vengeance for their father's death, Halfdan and his brothers assemble a formidable force. What is this army famously known as?
Halfdan's journey took him to the heart of England, where he and one of his brothers laid siege to a major city. Which brother stood by his side?
After many conquests, Halfdan’s path led him to a significant seat of power. Which city did he rule?
The Raven Banner: In battle, Halfdan and his brothers were often recognised by a particular standard, symbolising their lineage and might. What was it?
Revenge Served Cold: Halfdan’s thirst for vengeance was rooted in the belief that a particular English King was responsible for his father’s death. Who was this King?
Halfdan’s journey was not without challenges. At one pivotal battle, he faced the combined forces of Wessex and Mercia. Which battle was it?
Throughout his life, Halfdan held many titles, but there’s one he never claimed. Which one?
Halfdan’s life was full of battles and conquests, but his demise is shrouded in mystery. How do some tales suggest he met his end?
options: Lost in a storm at sea
Assassinated in the alleys of Dublin
VikingQuestions.answer: Assassinated in the alleys of Dublin

VikingQuestions.question: Despite the passing of time, Halfdan’s legacy remains, echoed in tales and songs. What is he NOT remembered for?

tudorQuestions.question: You are Henry VIII, how many wives did you have during your lifetime?
What is the correct order of your wives?
options: Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine Parr, Catherine Howard
Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine Howard, Catherine Parr
Catherine of Aragon, Anne of Cleves, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Catherine Parr, Catherine Howard
Catherine Howard, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine of Aragon, Catherine Parr
tudorQuestions.answer: Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine Howard, Catherine Parr

tudorQuestions.question: You are married to Catherine of Aragon, and want to leave her, what do you do?
options: Have the Catholic Church allow you to divorce her
Have the Protestant Church allow you to divorce her
Create the Church of England to divorce her
tudorQuestions.answer: Create the Church of England to divorce her

tudorQuestions.question: You are married to Anne Bolyen and have found out she just cheated on you, what do you do?
You're married to Jane Seymor, she gives you what you've always wanted. What is this?
What is the correct order of your wives' cause of death?
options: Divorced, beheaded survived, divorced, beheaded, died
Beheaded, divorced, died, beheaded, divorced, died
Beheaded, divorced, died, beheaded, divorced, survived
Divorced, beheaded, died, divorced, beheaded, survived
tudorQuestions.answer: Divorced, beheaded, died, divorced, beheaded, survived

tudorQuestions.question: What happened when you first met Anne of Cleves?
options: You found out she had an affair

tudorQuestions.question: Catherine Howard was related to one of your previous wives, who was she related to?
What happened when you married Catherine Parr?
options: You died in a jousting competition in January 1547
You died from an infected wound in January 1547
tudorQuestions.answer: You died from an infected wound in January 1547

tudorQuestions.question: Who did you wish to be buried beside?
Who were your children?
options: Edward VI, Mary I, Elizabeth I
Mary I, Edward VII, Elizabeth I
Mary I, Edward VII, Elizabeth I, Charles II
tudorQuestions.answer: Edward VI, Mary I, Elizabeth I
